*In February 2004, an automated [[news ticker]] on [[News 14 Carolina]], a North Carolina cable channel, was â[[Hack (technology slang)|hacked]]â to display the message on television.<ref>{{cite web | author=Poulsen, Kevin | year=2004-03-05 | work=The Register | url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2004/03/05/wags_hijack_tv_channels_onscreen/ | title=Wags hijack TV channel's on-screen ticker | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
*When Google launched [[Google Base]] in October 2005, the phrase was twisted into âAll Your Base Are Belong To Googleâ by search industry watchers such as [[John Battelle]].<ref>{{cite web | author=Battelle, John | year=2005-10-25 | url=http://battellemedia.com/archives/001960.php | title=base.google.com (Or...All Your Base Are Belong To Google) | work=John Battelle's Searchblog | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref> Furthermore, in Google's [http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/ Hacker Translation], the âPersonalized Homeâ link has been translated into â4LL `/0|_||2 B453,â which is [[Leet]] for âAll Your Base.â
*When Google launched [[Google Base]] in October 2005, the phrase was twisted into âAll Your Base Are Belong To Googleâ by search industry watchers such as [[John Battelle]].<ref>{{cite web | author=Battelle, John | year=2005-10-25 | url=http://battellemedia.com/archives/001960.php | title=base.google.com (Or...All Your Base Are Belong To Google) | work=John Battelle's Searchblog | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref> Furthermore, in Google's [http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/ Hacker Translation], the âPersonalized Homeâ link has been translated into â4LL `/0|_||2 B453,â which is [[Leet]] for âAll Your Base.â

*On June 1 2006, the video hosting website [[YouTube]] was taken down temporarily for maintenance. The phrase "ALL YOUR VIDEO ARE BELONG TO US" below the YouTube logo served as a placeholder while the site was down.
+
*On June 1 2006, the video hosting website [[YouTube]] was taken down temporarily for maintenance. The phrase "ALL YOUR VIDEO ARE BELONG TO US" below the YouTube logo served as a placeholder while the site was down.{{fact}}
